title: Men's Bracketology: UNC is still in, plus more updates from a busy Friday
content: It's going to be a weekend-long debate: North Carolina, with good metrics and few quality wins, versus Texas, which has plenty of really good wins but a so-so record.

title: Ohtani hits long home run in return to Japan
content: In an exhibition game against the Yomiuri Giants, Dodgers star Shohei Ohtani belted a long two-run homer to right field in the third inning in his return to the Tokyo Dome.

title: Source: 49ers, Juszczyk reunite after brief split
content: After a brief parting, fullback Kyle Juszczyk is returning to the 49ers on a two-year, $8 million deal, a source told ESPN.

title: Source: Kupp to join Seahawks on 3-year deal
content: Cooper Kupp has reached an agreement with the Seahawks, with a source saying the wide receiver is getting a three-year, $45 million contract.

title: Sources: NBA looking into OKC sitting 5 starters
content: The NBA is investigating a March 7 game in which the Thunder rested starters Shai Gilgeous-Alexander, Jalen Williams, Chet Holmgren, Luguentz Dort and Isaiah Hartenstein as well as Cason Wallace, sources told ESPN.

title: UConn-Creighton ends in scuffle over 'fancy' dunk
content: A scuffle broke out at the end of Creighton's victory over UConn in a Big East tournament semifinal after Jamiya Neal threw down a needless dunk for the Bluejays in the final seconds.

title: UNC refuses to blame lane violation for costly loss
content: The prevailing mantra in the aftermath of North Carolina's loss to Duke: The Tar Heels had done enough to lose long before a costly lane violation with 4.1 seconds left, yet this was still a team more than deserving of a spot in the NCAA tournament.

title: Sankey: Record 14 NCAA bids 'justified' for SEC
content: SEC commissioner Greg Sankey says his league has been "incomparable" this season and expects no less than a record 14 teams to make the men's NCAA tournament.

title: Chargers bolster OL, agree to deal with Becton
content: The Chargers agreed to a two-year deal with guard Mekhi Becton on Friday, perhaps the team's most important signing of free agency.

title: Women's Bracketology: Ivy remains three-bid league as Princeton edges Virginia Tech for final spot on bubble
content: Princeton lost in the Ivy semifinals Friday, but played well enough to become the "Last Team In" the field. Virginia Tech remains "First Team Out."

title: Making sense of QB moves in NFL free agency: We ranked the 10 best fits and answered big questions
content: Sam Darnold to Seattle. Geno Smith to Las Vegas. Aaron Rodgers to ...? Our experts sort through quarterback signings, trades and extensions.

title: NHL playoff standings: Dissecting the Eastern wild-card race
content: The Sens are in good shape, but five teams within two points are vying for the second spot. Plus, full playoff projections, draft lottery standings, more.

title: 'You don't hang banners for milestones': Tom Izzo adapts and takes aim at another title
content: Izzo is surpassing milestones and reached a big anniversary of his lone title. At 70, with a highly ranked team, he's hoping to add to his legacy.

title: Cooper Flagg injury impact: Duke isn't 'Final Four good' without him, more reactions
content: How could Flagg's and Maliq Brown's potential absences impact the Blue Devils on the court -- and on Selection Sunday?

title: Team-by-team preview: Can Orlando Pride repeat as champions?
content: With the National Women's Soccer League returning to action this weekend, we take a look at where the 14 clubs stands and how close each is to winning the NWSL championship.

title: NWSL's BOS Nation to be renamed after backlash
content: Boston's 2026 NWSL franchise announced Friday that it will officially change its name following a highly-ridiculed launch last fall.

title: Estadio Azteca changes name ahead of 2026 WC
content: Mexico City's Estadio Azteca has changed its name to Estadio Banorte in order to help fund the final stages of remodeling for the upcoming 2026 World Cup.

title: Neymar ruled out of Brazil return, Endrick in
content: Neymar's return to action for Brazil will be delayed yet longer after the forward was ruled out of his country's squad for upcoming World Cup qualifiers on Friday due to a thigh injury.

title: Pride open season with 6-0 rout; Rodman returns
content: The reigning champion Orlando Pride opened the National Women's Soccer League season on Friday night with a 6-0 home field rout over the Chicago Stars.

title: Guardiola laughs off Capello calling him 'arrogant'
content: Pep Guardiola has laughed off criticism from Fabio Capello after the former England manager accused the Manchester City boss of ruining Italian football.

title: USMNT, Seattle winger Arriola suffers torn ACL
content: USMNT winger Paul Arriola suffered a torn ACL in the Seattle Sounders' Concacaf Champions Cup loss at Cruz Azul on Tuesday, the MLS club has confirmed.

title: Rashford returns in Tuchel's first England squad
content: Thomas Tuchel has handed Marcus Rashford a shock recall in his first England squad, which also includes call-ups for Myles Lewis-Skelly, Dominic Solanke and Dan Burn.

title: Atleti's Gallagher: Focus now on beating Barça
content: Atlético Madrid midfielder Conor Gallagher said the team has moved on from the painful UEFA Champions League exit against Real Madrid in a controversial penalty shootout on Wednesday.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid eye Spurs defender Cristian Romero
content: A summer move for World Cup-winning defender Cristian Romero is being considered by Real Madrid. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Why Geovany Quenda can be Chelsea's answer to Saka
content: Chelsea look set to land the Sporting CP teen in 2026 and Quenda's style has been compared to an Arsenal star.

title: 75 years of innovation: How F1 has evolved since 1950 and where it's headed
content: To celebrate F1's 75th anniversary, ESPN charts the sport's evolution since 1950 through its most iconic cars, and details where it's headed in 2026.

title: Ronald Acuna Jr. says he'll be more careful this season -- but no one believes him
content: From 40/70 to 40/30? The Braves' 2023 NL MVP is rehabbing with a plan to be stronger -- and healthier.

title: UFC expert picks, best bets: How Vettori can win in return from layoff
content: Who has the edge in this week's UFC Fight Night? An MMA coach and a betting insider make their picks.

title: Jason Sudeikis confirms 'Ted Lasso' Season 4, teases new team
content: Sudeikis said on the "New Heights" podcast that Lasso would be coaching a women's team in the new season.

title: Pawan Kalyan Says DMK Allows Tamil Films' Dubbing In Hindi, Party Responds
content: The Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) today responded to remarks made by actor-turned-politician Pawan Kalyan over the ongoing language debate.

title: "4% Quota Not Only For Muslims": DK Shivakumar On Big Karnataka Decision
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has backed Chief Minister Siddaramaiah over the 4 per cent quota issue, which the Congress's rivals called a move to appease Muslims.

title: Arrested From Aircraft, Tortured: Actor Ranya Rao's Explosive Allegations
content: Actor Ranya Rao has claimed that she has been subjected to custodial torture and falsely implicated in the high-profile gold smuggling case.

title: "Thumka Lagao Or Get Suspended": Tej Pratap Yadav's Order To Cop Sparks Row
content: Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD) leader Tej Pratap Yadav celebrated Holi with party workers at his official residence in Patna on Saturday. A video from the event, which has since gone viral on social media, has sparked controversy.

title: Pakistan, Bhutan Among 41 Countries On Trump's Potential Travel Ban List
content: The memo lists a total of 41 countries divided into three separate groups. The first group of 10 countries, including Afghanistan, Iran, Syria, Cuba and North Korea among others, would be set for a full visa suspension.

title: Indian Student Self-Deports After US Revokes Visa For "Supporting" Hamas
content: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem posted a video of Ranjani Srinivasan at the airport and said that anyone "advocating for violence and terrorism should not be in the country".

title: "Only Had Bhaang": Gujarat Law Student Blames Airbags For Deadly Crash
content: The 20-year-old law student, whose car rammed nearby vehicles and passersby, causing the death of one person and injuring several others in Vadodara, told the police he could not see the road as airbags had opened inside the vehicle.

title: Kohli Takes Big Call Over Coming Out Of T20I Retirement For This Mega Event
content: Virat Kohli announced his retirement from the format after the T20 World Cup final, which India won after beating South Africa in Barbados.

title: Karnataka BJP Leader, Cop In A Midnight Slap Fight. Video Is Viral
content: It appeared like a power slap contest. The match played out between a cop and a BJP leader in Karnataka.

title: Who Is Ranjani Srinivasan, Indian Self-Deported From US
content: Ranjani Srinivasan is a doctoral student in urban planning from Columbia University's Graduate School of Architecture, Planning and Preservation.

title: "She Made Television Tonight": Trump As Reporter Bumps Mic Into His Face
content: During a press interaction, a reporter accidentally bumped a microphone into Donald Trump's face, prompting a sharp reaction from the US President.

title: Video: Porch Roof Collapses During Party In Oakland, Leaving 16 Injured
content: At least 16 people were injured when a roof collapsed during a house party in Oakland near the University of Pittsburgh campus on Friday.

title: Sunita Williams Closer To Homecoming, NASA, SpaceX Launch Crew-10 Mission
content: The NASA and billionaire Elon Musk's SpaceX on Friday (local time) launched the Crew-10 mission to bring back stranded astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore.

title: Andhra Man Kills Sons For 'Poor Academic Performance', Dies By Suicide
content: A 37-year-old ONGC employee has allegedly killed his two minor sons for "poor academic performance" and died by suicide in Andhra Pradesh's Kakinada, a police official said on Saturday.

title: NDTV Explains New Bill That Can Deny Foreigners Visas Over 'National Security'
content: Foreigners can be denied visas on national security grounds, their movements can be restricted, and they can be penalised for violating rules governing entry into, and exit from, India, according to a proposed law tabled by Home Minister Amit Shah.

title: Never opposed Hindi as a language but only opposed making it compulsory: Pawan Kalyan
content: When the National Education Policy does not enforce Hindi, spreading false narratives about its imposition is nothing but an attempt to mislead the public, he observes in a post on X

title: NEWS ANALYSIS IUML refines strategies to consolidate position in 2026 polls
content: Party has strengthened its organisational structure, improved its relationships with the other UDF partners and enhanced its appeal to a broader electorate

title: ASHAs to lay siege to Kerala Secretariat on March 16
content: While ASHAs strike for better pay completes 34 days, the Health department and the National Health Mission continue to  maintain that less than 7% of the 26,125 ASHAs across the State are agitating. The Centre and State remain at odds over their remuneration and allocations.

title: DYFI flags at temple festival in Kollam: TDB orders vigilance probe
content: Display of political flags or symbols inside temples is strictly prohibited by the courts and the board had issued a circular regarding this to all places of worship under its control, says TDB president

title: Tamil a sweet language; PM wants every language to get its due respect: Union Minister Vaishnaw
content: We should all look at one big goal of making our country very strong, making sure that we become the third largest economy, Vaishnaw said

title: Tiruchi Corporation to take up survey of areas without street lights
content: Junior engineers in all five zones had been instructed to carry out the study to identify areas without street lights and those that needed to be replaced in their divisions

title: Alappuzha’s first AWBI-approved ABC centre set to open at Kanichukulangara
content: The ABC centre includes a main building, sheds and kennels to accommodate 50 dogs at a time. It can sterilise up to 10 dogs a day.

title: Frequency of Rahul's visits to Vietnam very curious: BJP
content: BJP leader Ravi Shankar Prasad said Rahul Gandhi was in the Southeast Asian country during the new year as well, claiming that he has spent nearly 22 days there.

title: Billion-dollar fund to support creators’ economy: I&B Minister
content: A key highlight of the high-level session ahead of WAVES 2025 was an MoU exchange between the I&B Ministry and the Maharashtra government for strengthening collaboration in media, entertainment, and digital outreach

title: People could be stripped and paraded if objectionable comments are made; but I act according to law: Telangana CM
content: Telangana Chief Minister deplores abusive language on social media, calls for amendments to current laws governing journalism

title: Avvaiyar memorial construction on in full swing in Nagapattinam
content: According to officials from the Hindu Religious and Charitable Endowments (HR&CE) department, the memorial will span approximately 11,000 sq ft.

title: Along with development, PM ensured unprecedented peace in Northeast, says Amit Shah
content: Amit Shah said the Centre was committed to developing Mizoram and relocating the Assam Rifles camp to outside Aizawl was a testament to it

title: Tiruchi restaurants serve up specially curated menu for Ramzan
content: The entry of new eateries in the city and greater exposure to global cuisine have added variety to the Ramzan menu and meals that were once confimed to homes are now available in restaurants

title: Sharad Pawar urges PM Modi to install equestrian statues of Maratha Empire warriors in Delhi
content: Sharad Pawar said a Pune-based NGO had planned to install busts of Bajirao, Shinde and Holkar at the Talkatora Stadium, but litterateurs and historians have weighed in favour of equestrian statues of the three warriors

title: Policeman dies after being assaulted by people involved in scuffle in Bihar's Munger, six held
content: This incident happened when the ASI along, with other officers, had gone to Nandlalpur village to investigate a case of scuffle around 8.30 pm on March 14; he was attacked with a sharp weapon on his head by some people involved in the scuffle during the investigation, police said

title: Sewage in urban bodies to be treated for agriculture, gardening by 2027: Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu
content: Andhra Pradesh Pollution Control Board has granted ₹50 crore aid and ₹100 crore loan to MA&UD Department for Solid Waste Mangement, says Chandrababu Naidu at Swatch Andhra-Swarna Andhra campaign in Tanuku

title: Kashmir Valley receives fresh snowfall on March 15
content: There is a possibility of intermittent brief spells of light rain or snow at several places towards March 16 morning, the Met office said

title: ‘ISI creating disturbance in Punjab,’ says Amritsar Commissioner after blast at Thakurdwara Temple
content: Police teams have seized the CCTV footage, and according to preliminary investigation, the youth on a motorcycle had a flag in his hands, and the two of them were standing around the temple for some time before lobbing the grenade

title: Revanth challenges KCR to debate over Krishna water allocation in Telangana Assembly
content: The Chief Minister also criticised KCR’s leadership, alleging that he barely attended Assembly sessions

title: Captive mines, merger with SAIL, revocation of strategic sale must to save Visakhapatnam Steel Plant: B.V. Raghavulu
content: The CPI(M) leader ridicules Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrabu Naidu for ‘trying to shift the blame on the previous government’ for the hike in power charges instead of taking up the issue with the Centre

title: Telangana tunnel collapse | Rescue work continues to trace remaining seven persons trapped under debris
content: Last 200 meters in the tunnel was divided into three stretches to speed up work; seismology scientists to submit initial report on tunnel collapse site next week

title: PM Modi to finalise bilateral agreements during his visit next month: Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Vijitha Herath
content: PM Modi to visit Sri Lanka to finalise agreements, strengthening bilateral cooperation and signing new memoranda of understandings

title: CFTRI to host network meeting on probiotics and fermented foods in Mysuru
content: The event is expected to help the participants understand innovation in probiotic-based products, discuss the challenges with researches and experts, showcase developed products to other entrepreneurs, and understand the regulatory aspects and face-to-face interaction with all possible stakeholders

title: Kerala man booked for pronouncing talaq to wife over phone
content: Case registered after his 21-year-old wife approached police alleging she had been subjected to physical and mental torture by her husband for some time demanding more dowry

title: No summons to my son, ED created media hype: Bhupesh Baghel
content: Following the ED’s search at Bhupesh Baghel’s house on March 10, there were unconfirmed reports that the ED had summoned his son Chaitanya to record his statement on March 15; Mr. Baghel said the question of going to the ED office did not arise if Chaitanya hadn’t received a notice

title: T.N. govt. allocates ₹45,661 crore for Agriculture Budget; horticulture becomes key driver of growth
content: Agriculture Minister M.R.K. Panneerselvam said the Budget had been tailored to seven distinct agro-climatic zones and the diverse crops cultivated across these regions

title: Menhirs of Mudumal in Telangana’s Narayanpet on tentative list of UNESCO World Heritage Sites
content: The stones numbering about 1200 large sized ones standing vertically map the skies as it existed 3000 years ago, said conservation architect Surya Narayan Murthy

title: Man kills his two sons over ‘insecurity of their future in competitive world’; ends his life in Andhra Pradesh’s Kakinada
content: The public sector unit employee has taken the extreme step after celebrating Holi with his family and colleagues

title: NWKRTC warns employees against sharing defamatory videos
content: A circular warned that employees recording such defamatory messages and sharing them in public has become a cause for worry in recent times

title: Left government’s position on offshore sand mining along Kerala coast lacks clarity, says V.D. Satheesan
content: Kerala Opposition Leader asks government to make its position clear on whether its demand is to get a share of royalty earned by Centre from sand mining

content: In the Agriculture Budget presented in the Assembly, Minister M.R.K. Panneerselvam said the purpose of the packages was to increase the area of paddy cultivation and food grain production during Kar, Kuruvai, and Sornavari seasons

title: Palaniswami downplays ‘differences’ with Sengottaiyan, emphasises ‘freedom’ within AIADMK
content: Pointing to his colleagues who were with him during his interaction with the media outside the Assembly chamber on the campus of Fort St. George on Friday, the AIADMK leader said not all the 62 MLAs of his party were present

title: Concrete mixing truck falls on car in Belagavi, passengers rescued
content: They were waiting for their relatives on the road near the KLE hospital when the truck fell on the car

content: Sources say CEC Gyanesh Kumar will discuss the issue with the Home Secretary, Legislative Secretary and CEO of UIDAI on March 18

content: Licypriya Kangujam was in Kochi to attend the first student conference organised by Indian Green Building Council at Cochin University of Science and Technology campus

title: Kannada Rakshana Vedike writes to Tamil Nadu Chief Minister appreciating decision to opt for Tamil letter ரூ instead of ₹ symbol in budget
content: The letter calls Dravidian movement of Tamil Nadu ‘the pride of the entire South Indian Dravidian speakers’, and said that it was imperative for all southern States to unitedly struggle for the survival of Dravidian languages

title: Congress didn’t allow peace in Assam, PM Modi restored it: Amit Shah during inauguration of Lachit Barphukan Police Academy

content: The prohibitory order suspending internet and call services cited concerns over the potential spreading of “rumours for unlawful activities.”

content: Based on a complaint, the police registered a case under relevant provisions of the Bharatiya Nyay Sanhita and POCSO Act for the assault that occurred in Panvel on March 3, an official said

title: MMK to appeal Jawahirullah’s conviction in Supreme Court
content: The Madras High Court had refused to interfere with the trial court verdict in the case in 2011, which gave Jawahirullah a one-year sentence

content: ISRO successfully conducts hot testing of cryogenic engine for LVM3 launch vehicle, improving efficiency for upcoming space missions

content: “Agroforestry is encouraged to provide additional income to farmers through the cultivation of high-value trees,” said Minister M.R.K. Panneerselvam

title: Explosion outside Thakur Dwara temple in Amritsar
content: While no one was hurt in the incident, it has caused panic among the residents in the Khandwala area of Amritsar.

title: Religious discrimination affects followers of all faiths: India in UNGA
content: India’s Permanent Representative to the U.N. Ambassador P. Harish was addressing the informal meeting of the plenary in the General Assembly to commemorate the International Day to Combat Islamophobia

title: Agriculture Budget: T.N. to implement Hill Farmers Development Scheme for cultivation of minor millets
content: “The scheme will include cultivation of minor millets, distribution of inputs, area expansion in vegetable crops, farm machineries, value addition, and Micro Irrigation and Integrated Farming System,” said Minister M.R.K. Panneerselvam

title: Militant arrested from Manipur's Kakching district
content: The member of the outlawed People's Liberation Army was apprehended from Langmeidong Mamang Leikai in Kakching

title: Haryana BJP leader shot dead in Sonipat over land dispute
content: The deceased has been identified as Surendra Jawahar, president of BJP's Mundlana Mandal in Sonipat, officials said

title: Man arrested with meth, ganja in Kochi
content: Arrest was part of intensified action by Kochi City police as part of D-Hunt, Kerala Police’s ongoing special drive against drugs

content: Presenting the Agriculture Budget for 2025, Agriculture Minister M.R.K. Panneerselvam said the Tamil Nadu Oil Seed Mission would be implemented at a cost of ₹108.06 crore to achieve self-sufficiency

title: Kalamassery polytechnic men’s hostel to come under CCTV coverage from next academic year
content: Move comes in the wake of seizure of nearly 2 kg of ganja from two rooms of the hostel during police raid and arrest of three final-year students

title: Why shouldn’t political parties pay rent for holding public meetings to police for providing security, asks HC judge
content: Justice G.K. Ilanthiraiyan says when parties spend money for erecting stages and making seating arrangements, then they should also be ready to pay costs to State authorities

title: Narrow escape for Rakesh Tikait as car collides with nilgai in UP's Muzaffarnagar
content: Mr. Tikait said the accident took place when his vehicle was near the Meerpur bypass road in Muzaffarnagar

content: Agriculture Minister M.R.K. Panneerselvam announced the creation of Uzhavar Nala Maiyam, or Farmers’ Welfare Centre, in 1,000 places

title: Ganja seizure at polytechnic hostel: Police take two former students of Kalamassery college into custody
content: Suspected to be dropouts, police suspect the duo to be behind supply of ganja seized from Government Polytechnic College, Kalamassery

title: Prepaid smart meters: KSEB again seeks Centre’s nod for grant for CAPEX mode roll-out
content: The Centre, however, is yet to give any assurance to the State government in this regard, according to Power department

title: Centre should release MGNREGA funds to West Bengal, says Parliamentary Standing Committee
content: Funds to the MGNREGA have been stalled for the past three years since March 2022, after the Centre invoked Section 27 of the MGNREGA 2005 which allows for stoppage of funds for violation of rules in implementation of the scheme by the State

title: Clashes erupt, vehicles torched during Holi procession in Jharkhand’s Giridih
content: The incident occurred when a Holi procession was passing through a street near the Ghodthambha Chowk in Giridih

title: India slams Pakistan for ‘unjustified’ reference to J&K in UNGA
content: India’s Representative in U.N. Harish said frequent references by Pakistan will “neither validate their claim nor justify their practice of cross-border terrorism”

title: Who is Ranjani Srinivasan, the Indian student at Columbia University who self-deported after visa revocation?
content: The Trump administration revoked the visa of Ranjani Srinivasan, an Indian citizen and doctoral student, “for advocating for violence and terrorism”

title: Mecca Masjid: a socio-political, religious and anti-colonial sanctuary
content: The masjid that played a pivotal role as a platform advocating the country’s freedom from British colonial rule,  now remains a crucial space for affirming the political agency of Hyderabad’s Muslims

title: Demolitions for metro line to pick up pace in Old City post Ramzan
content: Some 80 properties have been lined for demolitions out of which 39 properties have been demolished and demolition of 41 more properties is in various stages of progress, also 1,100 properties in total have been identified for land acquisition and notifications were issued for about 980 by Hyderabad District Collector, Managing Director of Hyderabad Airport Metro Limited said

title: Child trafficking racket has its trail in other States as well, say police
content: The accused alleged trafficked infants from Delhi, Gujarat, Maharashtra and other States; teams would be sent to nab the accused, say police

title: Near historical Hampi, a heinous crime
content: On the night of March 6, Bibhas Nayak from Odisha was killed and two women — an Israeli tourist and an Indian homestay operator — were gang-raped by three men when they went stargazing at Sanapura lake near Hampi, a UNESCO World Heritage site, in Karnataka. Kumar Buradikatti pieces together the crime that took place in a region that is generally considered safe

title: Mother tongue-based multilingual education to help tribal children bridge linguistic divide in Andhra Pradesh
content: The Mother Tongue-Based Multilingual Education programme is operational in 1454 schools in eight districts, covering six tribal languages of Savara, Sugali, Konda, Koya, Kuvi and Adivasi Oriya

title: A rally, some ruffled feathers, and the republic on the defensive as monarchy debate resurfaces in Nepal
content: On March 9, Gyanendra, who was dethroned in 2008, arrived in Kathmandu, sparking a rally calling for the monarchy’s return; the rally highlighted public frustration with the current republic system, reflecting dissatisfaction with political leaders who have failed to meet expectations; as monarchists call for the reinstatement of the institution, observers call for strengthening the republican system

title: BRS leaders lodge complaints in police stations against Telangana CM for ‘mortuary’ remarks
content: BRS leaders file complaints against CM Revanth Reddy for criminal comments, seek legal action and protection for KCR

title: Archie and friends learn about Holi in new edition of comic
content: The Holi celebration is part of a new 10-page Archie comic story in The World of Betty & Veronica digest #38 released Thursday (March 13, 2025)

title: Temple accountant attacked with acid by unidentified assailant
content: Police investigate acid attack on Pedda Thota Bhu Lakshmi Temple accountant; suspect unidentified, investigation ongoing

title: Tamil Nadu Budget 2025 caters to key sectors, core voter base
content: While the State’s overall debt burden is expected to rise to ₹9,29,959.3 crore, the Debt to GSDP ratio remains within the prescribed limits at 26.07%.

title: What do the first two rounds of a perfect draft look like?
content: fantasy baseball managers all over the world are getting ready for those ever-crucial drafts . they say practice makes perfect -- and you can certainly practice your drafting skills in our Mock Draft Lobby . Tristan H. Cockcroft and Eric Karabell weighed in on each of their ideal picks from each of the 10 draft positions in an ESPN standard league .

title: Tracking NFL free agency: Live updates on every signing, trade, cut and rumor
content: free agency kicked off with the legal negotiation window on Monday . players can now officially sign with new teams as of Wednesday . the new league year was the start of the new season . a number of players have already signed with the seahawks .

title: EA Sports FC 25 gets free version with the Legends Return update
content: free-to-play edition of the game is available on all platforms aside from Switch . kick off, Club Rush, and Learn To Play will be available as game modes featuring teams from Germany's Bundesliga and Frauen-Bundesliga . this first rotation will end on Apr. 2.

title: How the sporting goods industry is bracing for tariffs
content: the talk of steep new taxes on imported products has created a flurry of questions for the sporting goods industry . in response to Trump imposing 25% tariffs on steel and aluminum, Canada will place 25% reciprocal tariffs . a new trade war will raise prices on a variety of consumer goods .

title: Did the Titans' free agency moves reveal what they'll do with the No. 1 pick?
content: the free agent quarterbacks flew off the list of options . they signed former 49ers backup Brandon Allen to a one-year, $1.4 million deal . it's hard to imagine a make-or-break season with Allen and Levis .

title: ‘He was getting buckets’: Cooper Flagg always seemed inevitable
content: Cooper Flagg suffered a left ankle injury late in the first half of Duke's ACC Tournament quarterfinal game against Georgia Tech . the flag is pinned to the siding above the front door of Nemer's home alongside Sebasticook Lake . his facebook page is a shrine to Flagg, an endless scroll of highlights, stats and overt gushing that might seem like hyperbole if directed at anyone other than college basketball's biggest star .

title: Power Rankings: Capitals back at No. 1, plus each team's playoff scoring leaders
content: a panel of ESPN hockey commentators, analysts, reporters and editors send in a 1-32 poll based on the games through Wednesday, which generates our master list . the top career playoff scorers for each of the league's teams are ranked by the NHL's official records site .

title: No 'trust the process'? What's next for the Phoenix Suns
content: Kevin Durant helps the Suns erase a 23-point deficit en route to defeating the Clippers . the suns had given up 41 points in the second quarter and trailed by 19 entering the fourth . Durant later downplayed his first-quarter sideline clash with coach Mike Budenholzer .

title: 'I was slapped, not given food': Actor Ranya Rao claims torture in custody
content: Ranya Rao, accused in a case, claims in a letter to the Directorate of Revenue Intelligence that she was falsely implicated, physically assaulted, and forced to sign documents under duress. She insists no evidence was recovered from her and requests that her statements given under pressure not be relied upon.

title: Lalu-style ‘kurta faad’ Holi returns as Bihar elections near
content: Tej Pratap Yadav, son of Lalu Yadav, ordered a police constable to dance during Holi celebrations to avoid suspension, stirring a controversy. The BJP criticized this act as reminiscent of 'Jungle Raj'. The incident comes as Bihar prepares for its upcoming assembly elections.

title: Infosys founder Narayana Murthy: Somehow it has become a fashion to ...
content: NR Narayana Murthy, co-founder of Infosys, addressed the hype around AI in India, stating that many systems are just traditional programming. He emphasized that genuine AI involves machine learning and deep learning, which can greatly enhance human-like capabilities.

title: 'A victory to cherish ...': VVS Laxman remembers iconic 2001 Kolkata Test win
content: Former India batter VVS Laxman reminisced on social media about the unforgettable 2001 Kolkata Test victory against Australia, calling it "a victory to cherish for a lifetime." Down 0-1 in the series, India staged a miraculous comeback with Laxman's 281 and a record 376-run partnership with Rahul Dravid. Harbhajan Singh's bowling sealed India's historic win.

title: 8-year-old raped in Bangladesh, dies after 3 cardiac arrests
content: An eight-year-old girl in Bangladesh succumbed to injuries after being raped, leading to widespread protests demanding justice and legal reforms. Authorities arrested several suspects, and the trial is anticipated to begin within seven days, seeking expedited justice under strict child protection laws.

title: Intel needs help from TSMC now, for at least ...: Zoho founder Sridhar Vembu
content: Sridhar Vembu discusses the long-term damage caused by financial bubbles, comparing them to flash floods that weaken neglected sectors. He highlights how the dominance of one industry, such as IT in India, can impair other critical industries, emphasizing the need to rebuild these capabilities. Vembu also emphasized the need to address these gaps and rebuild capabilities in neglected sectors. "We have to make up for lost time," Vembu concluded.

title: Only days spent in India to decide NRI tax status: ITAT
content: Mumbai ITAT ruled in favor of M Gulati, confirming his non-resident status as he spent 210 days abroad. The tribunal clarified that both employment and job search periods abroad qualify for non-residency. This ruling means non-residents are not taxed on overseas income, benefiting expatriates seeking employment abroad.

title: Trump travel restriction on 41 countries in the works - full list
content: The Trump administration is preparing a three-tier travel restriction that will affect entry to the US from 41 countries, including an outright ban for 11 nations like Afghanistan and Bhutan. This move, a significant expansion of the previous travel ban, has caused alarm among potential immigrants, with final decisions due soon.

title: Cognizant starts sending bonus letters to eligible employees; says it is ...
content: Cognizant announces bonus payouts for eligible employees, ranging from 85% to 115%, to be distributed between March and April 2024. Merit pay increases will take effect from August 1, 2025.

title: 'Beaten, ate jailed food': Amit Shah on detention under Cong govt in Assam
content: Union Home Minister Amit Shah recollected his student days when he protested against Indira Gandhi in Assam, highlighting his detention and mistreatment under the Congress government. Shah also emphasized the peace restoration efforts and projected the Lachit Barphukan Police Academy to become a premier institution within five years.

title: 'Nahi thumka lagaoge toh ... ': Tej Pratap orders policeman to dance
content: RJD leader Tej Pratap Yadav's Holi celebration with party workers sparked controversy after a video showed him ordering a policeman to dance, threatening suspension. Political opponents criticized the act, calling it a display of power abuse and reminiscent of past 'jungle raj' in Bihar.

title: Vasan, Annamalai term T.N. Agriculture Budget ‘disappointing for farmers’
content: health Matters Ramya Kannan writes to you on getting to good health, and staying there The View From India Looking at World Affairs from the Indian perspective . the weekly newsletter from science writers takes the jargon out of science and puts the fun in!

title: Man ‘kills’ girl as she refused to have sex with him in Punjab
content: Police arrested Sanjeet Kumar, 26, for allegedly murdering a minor girl in Ludhiana after she refused to have sex with him. The girl's naked body was found near a railway line, leading to a probe which identified the accused, who had been working near the victim's home.

title: 'Frequent visits are curious': BJP slams Rahul Gandhi for visiting Vietnam in Holi
content: BJP criticizes Congress leader Rahul Gandhi for frequent visits to Vietnam, questioning his fondness for the country. BJP MP Ravi Shankar Prasad expressed concerns about the trips' timing, including one during a national mourning period. Congress defends Rahul, stating he was there to study Vietnam's economic model.

title: 'The King is here': Virat Kohli arrives in Bengaluru for IPL 2025 - Watch
content: Virat Kohli has arrived in Bengaluru for the 2025 IPL season, ready to support RCB under new captain Rajat Patidar. The season opener against KKR is set for March 22. Kohli expressed confidence in Patidar’s leadership, acknowledging his growth and dedication. Fans eagerly await the new season as RCB aims for their first IPL title.

title: Who is Ranjani Srinivasan? Why did the US revoke the Indian scholar's visa?
content: The US Department of Homeland Security announced the self-deportation of Ranjani Srinivasan, an Indian doctoral student, after her visa was revoked for supporting Hamas and advocating violence. This is part of a broader crackdown on foreign students involved in pro-Palestinian activism. Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem said that living and studying in the US is a privilege and should not be extended to those who support terrorism.

title: David Warner set to make Indian cinema debut; first look revealed
content: Former cricketer David Warner is making his debut in Telugu cinema with a cameo in the movie 'Robinhood,' starring Nithiin and Sreeleela, releasing on March 28. Directed by Venky Kudumula, the film is an action-packed entertainer with music by GV Prakash Kumar. Warner's popular TikTok dance videos to Telugu songs have already endeared him to fans.

title: IndusInd bank well-capitalised; no need for depositors to worry: RBI
content: The Reserve Bank of India confirmed IndusInd Bank's strong financial parameters and robust health amid reported discrepancies. IndusInd Bank is implementing remedial measures and undergoing an external audit. Despite leadership changes and internal process issues, the bank remains financially stable.

title: 'Parcels labelled as chicken': Delhi-Goa beef smuggling network exposed
content: Over 500kg of decomposing beef was found at Margao railway station, revealing a smuggling operation transporting beef from Delhi to Goa under false documentation. Parcels were labeled as chicken and used gaps in the railway's inspection system. This was triggered by the meat spoiling due to unusually warm weather. Authorities are investigating the larger network.

title: 'Struck on head': How a 'drunken' brawl in Bihar's Munger led to ASI's death
content: According to Munger Superintendent of Police (SP) Syed Imran Masood, "ASI Santosh Kumar Singh lost his life after being attacked by individuals in Munger. He was responding to a ruckus created by the family of a man identified as Ranveer Kumar in Nandalpur village under Mufassil police station limits."

title: Vadodara car crash: Pall of gloom descends on retired teacher’s family
content: A tragic accident occurred in Vadodara, where 23-year-old law student Rakshit Ravish Chaurasia allegedly killed Hemali Patel and injured eight others with a speeding car. Hemali's father-in-law, retired teacher Dipak Patel, is devastated as his critically injured son Purav fights for his life in SSG Hospital.

title: 'Didn't want him, others to see potholes': Trump cites PM Modi’s visit in DOJ speech
content: President Trump referenced PM Modi's visit to the US in a speech at the DOJ, highlighting efforts to present a clean and safe Washington DC. He emphasized plans to eliminate crime, graffiti, and tents. Trump also criticized former President Biden's administration, branding it as a 'Department of Injustice', while promising justice and accountability moving forward.

title: 'Bura na mano Holi hai': Nana Patole asks deputy CMs Pawar, Shinde to join MVA
content: Former Maharashtra Congress president Nana Patole has suggested a potential shift in the state's political landscape by inviting deputy CMs Eknath Shinde and Ajit Pawar to form a government without CM Devendra Fadnavis. His comments come amid reports of friction within the ruling alliance.

title: 'Had unexploded suicide vest on': Video shows US missile strike on ISIS leader
content: US Central Command, in coordination with Iraqi Intelligence and Security Forces, conducted a precision airstrike that killed Abdallah Makki Muslih al-Rifai, also known as Abu Khadijah, the second-highest-ranking ISIS leader. The operation marks a significant blow to ISIS leadership and their global operations.

title: 'Happy 4': Wife Sanjana pens heartfelt lyrics for Bumrah on anniversary
content: Jasprit Bumrah and Sanjana Ganesan celebrated their fourth anniversary, sharing heartfelt messages. Bumrah's continued recovery from a back injury has kept him off the field, impacting the Indian team's campaigns. His return remains uncertain as he works on regaining fitness for upcoming matches, with Mumbai Indians hopeful for his participation in IPL 2025.

title: Who’s replacing Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore? Meet the Crew-10 astronauts
content: NASA’s Crew-10 mission, launched aboard a SpaceX Falcon 9, is set to dock with the ISS on March 15-16. The mission marks the return of NASA astronauts Sunita Williams and Barry Wilmore after nine months due to technical delays with Boeing's Starliner. Crew-10 will undertake scientific research and maintenance tasks preparing for future space explorations.

title: Grenade attack on Hindu temple in Punjab's Khandwala
content: Unidentified attackers threw a grenade at the Thakurdwara temple in Amritsar early Saturday morning, causing an explosion but no casualties. Police are examining CCTV footage, and investigations are underway to identify the assailants.

title: Acid attack in Telangana: Temple accountant suffers burn injuries on face
content: An accountant at a religious site in Hyderabad sustained burn injuries after an unknown assailant threw acid on him. The attacker approached the victim, Narsing Rao, and poured the acid before fleeing on a bike. Security has been heightened following the incident.

title: Indian scholar self-deports after US revokes visa for being 'terrorist sympathiser'
content: Columbia University's Ranjani Srinivasan self-deported after the US revoked her student visa for alleged pro-terrorist activities. Homeland officials cited her participation in pro-Palestine protests. No direct evidence of her supporting terrorism was provided. Authorities are prioritizing national security amid rising tensions over immigration policies.

title: Violence in WB's Birbhum: Security force deployed, internet suspended
content: Internet and voice-over-Internet telephony services have been suspended in five Gram Panchayat regions near Sainthia town, Birbhum district, West Bengal, from March 14 to March 17. This decision aims to curb rumour-mongering and illegal activities, amid recent stone-pelting incidents. Voice calls and SMS remain unaffected, ensuring ongoing communication through traditional means.

title: Samastha Kerala Madrasa exam result 2025: Click here to check results
content: Kerala Samastha Madrasa results 2025: The Samastha Kerala Sunni Vidyabhyasa Board announces the Kerala Madrasa Results 2025 for Classes 5, 7, 10, and 12. Students can check their results at samastha.in by selecting their class and entering their registration number. Detailed steps for downloading the results are provided on the website.

title: 'Fanatical mindset': India slams Pakistan in UN over 'unjustified' reference to J&K
content: India strongly objected to Pakistan's mention of Jammu and Kashmir at the UN General Assembly, emphasizing that such references do not substantiate territorial claims. India highlighted Pakistan's history of cross-border terrorism and bigotry, asserting Jammu and Kashmir as an integral part of India.

title: Maharashtra: 'Social justice, tribal department funds cut; given to Ladki Yojana'
content: Sanjay Shirsat, Shiv Sena's social justice minister, highlighted that the Ladki Bahin Yojana has resulted in a significant reallocation of funds, diverting Rs 10,000 crore from social justice and tribal departments. Despite an overall hike in SC and ST components, funds for critical social welfare departments were reduced. A top bureaucrat confirmed the diversion of funds.

title: Trump admin mulls travel restrictions on 43 nations; Pak, Iran on list: Report
content: According to the report, the countries have been divided into three groups of 11, 10 and 22, respectively. The first group is reportedly called the 'red list,' the second group is called 'orange list,' while the third one has been named 'yellow list.'

title: Vadodara car crash accused blames pothole, denies drunk driving
content: Rakshit Ravish Chaurasia, a 23-year-old law student, denied being drunk during a car accident in Vadodara that killed a woman and injured four others. He claimed the accident occurred after his car's airbags deployed suddenly. CCTV footage captured the incident, and Chaurasia has been arrested and booked for culpable homicide not amounting to murder.

title: Sachin Tendulkar plays prank with Yuvraj Singh and Ambati Rayudu
content: Sachin Tendulkar celebrated Holi with teammates from the India Masters, enhancing team spirit ahead of their International Masters League T20 final. India Masters avenged their earlier defeat to Australia with a commanding 94-run victory, securing their spot in the final and showcasing their unity and determination.

title: UK schoolboy memorizes record-breaking Pi digits
content: 10-year-old Alberto Davila Aragon from Bristol, UK set a new world record by recalling 280 decimal places of Pi in one minute on Pi Day, March 14, 2024. Alberto's achievement, recognized by Guinness World Records, was facilitated by his parents and held at Clifton Observatory. He used patterns and rhythms to aid his memory.

title: IPL 2025: Jasprit Bumrah likely to miss start of season
content: Jasprit Bumrah is likely to miss the start of IPL 2025 due to a back injury he has been recovering from since January. The pacer has not set a definitive return date. In his absence, Mumbai Indians must rely on other bowlers for their initial matches. Sanju Samson and Mayank Yadav's fitness is also being assessed.

title: 'Hold that rock up, baby': DK Metcalf reveals engagement to Normani
content: the two-time pro bowler revealed he's engaged to R&B star Normani . the couple began dating in 2022 after being introduced by singer Ciara . he joined fifth Harmony, a girl group formed from solo contestants .

title: How Chelsea Gray and Angel Reese powered the Rose to the semifinals

title: Rs 4,347 Crore For Cricket's 'Grand Slam'. Report Says 'Secret Plan' By...
content: the proposed eight-team league will follow a tennis grand Slam-like model . the league will be backed by SRJ Sports Investments, headed by Danny Townsend . discussions about the league have been going of for a year between the SRj sports investments and the international cricket council .
